alert.note: Alert for Boulder And Jefferson Counties Below 6000 Feet, West Broomfield County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 05 at 4:37PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Broomfield, northeastern Jefferson and eastern Boulder Counties through 515 PM MDT... At 437 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Superior, or 17 miles northwest of Denver, moving north at 15 mph. HAZARD...Penny size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Westminster, Boulder, Longmont, southwestern Broomfield, Lafayette, Louisville, Erie, Superior, Lyons and Niwot. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.75 IN MAX WIND GUST...<30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Boulder And Jefferson Counties Below 6000 Feet, West Broomfield County
